intro: Callicarpa kinabaluensis var. gibotii, commonly known as the Bornean beautyberry, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, vibrant purple berries. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest habitats at higher elevations. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and white, clustered in inflorescences. The berries, which are edible, are a notable feature of the plant and attract various bird species.
